definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

pinyin: Mei3 li4 jian1 He2 zhong4 guo2

sentences.english: Never forget your best friends in America.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要忘記你在美利堅合衆國的好伴侶。

sentences.english: Markets will rise and fall, but this is the United States of America.
sentences.chinese: 市場有起有伏，但這裏是美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: The only suchcountry is the United States of America.
sentences.chinese: 唯一這樣的國度就是美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: God bless you. And may God bless the United States of America.
sentences.chinese: 天主保佑你們，怨亓保佑美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: Now they have overtaken Russia and loom in the US's sights.
sentences.chinese: 而現在，他力壓俄羅斯，震怖美利堅。

sentences.english: I am a United States of America Air Force Lieutenant Colonel.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個美利堅合衆國空軍陸軍中尉上校。

sentences.english: Welcome to the United States of America. Hwan-ying.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎各位來到美利堅合衆國，歡迎。

sentences.english: The combination of the 50 states form the united state of america.
sentences.chinese: 五十個州結爲一體組成了美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: The sixteenth president of the United States.
Thank you. God bless you. And God bless the United States of America
sentences.chinese: 謝謝，願上帝保祐你們，保祐美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: Markets will rise and fingl! but this is the United Stconsumeds ofAmerica.
sentences.chinese: 市場有起有伏，但這裏是美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: 'Markets will rise and fall, but this is the United States of America, ' Mr. Obama said.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬說，市場會起起落落，不過這是美利堅合衆國。

sentences.english: Cause this is America- the pl_ web is owned by no god.
sentences.chinese: 由於這裏是美利堅，不屬於神的地址。

sentences.english: Can we at least change the country's name to the United States of Klepto-Plutocrats ?
sentences.chinese: 我們能不能至少把國名改成”美利堅權貴竊國“？
歷史將向你們美利堅緻敬。

sentences.english: Jackson Hole – Beijing Villas is a resort community near the Great Wall, outside of Beijing, China.
sentences.chinese: 原鄉美利堅是北京郊區長城附近的一個度假村。

definition: to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
style of study/academic atmosphere/school discipline/school traditions
foreign land/a place far from home
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
